1.text: Stand fast, and be not held again under the yoke of bondage.

2.text: Behold, I Paul tell you, that if you be circumcised, Christ shall profit you nothing.

3.text: And I testify again to every man circumcising himself, that he is a debtor to the whole law.

4.text: You are made void of Christ, you who are justified in the law: you are fallen from grace.

5.text: For we in spirit, by faith, wait for the hope of justice.

6.text: For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision availeth any thing, nor uncircumcision: but faith that worketh by charity.

7.text: You did run well, who hath hindered you, that you should not obey the truth?

8.text: This persuasion is not from him that calleth you.

9.text: A little leaven corrupteth the whole lump.

10.text: I have confidence in you in the Lord: that you will not be of another mind: but he that troubleth you, shall bear the judgment, whosoever he be.

11.text: And I, brethren, if I yet preach circumcision, why do I yet suffer persecution? Then is the scandal of the cross made void.

12.text: I would they were even cut off, who trouble you.

13.text: For you, brethren, have been called unto liberty: only make not liberty an occasion to the flesh, but by charity of the spirit serve one another.

14.text: For all the law is fulfilled in one word: Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

15.text: But if you bite and devour one another; take heed you be not consumed one of another.

16.text: I say then, walk in the spirit, and you shall not fulfil the lusts of the flesh.

17.text: For the flesh lusteth against the spirit: and the spirit against the flesh; for these are contrary one to another: so that you do not the things that you would.

18.text: But if you are led by the spirit, you are not under the law.

19.text: Now the works of the flesh are manifest, which are fornication, uncleanness, immodesty, luxury,

20.text: Idolatry, witchcrafts, enmities, contentions, emulations, wraths, quarrels, dissensions, sects,

21.text: Envies, murders, drunkenness, revellings, and such like. Of the which I foretell you, as I have foretold to you, that they who do such things shall not obtain the kingdom of God.

22.text: But the fruit of the Spirit is, charity, joy, peace, patience, benignity, goodness, longanimity,

23.text: Mildness, faith, modesty, continency, chastity. Against such there is no law.

24.text: And they that are Christâ€™s, have crucified their flesh, with the vices and concupiscences.

25.text: If we live in the Spirit, let us also walk in the Spirit.

26.text: Let us not be made desirous of vain glory, provoking one another, envying on another.
